actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans.

official_title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the authority of the Chief Medical Director or designee regarding review of the performance of probationary title 38 health care employees.

summary.text: Revises Federal law concerning performance evaluations and disciplinary actions for certain health care employees of the Veterans Health Services and Research Administration of the Department of Veterans Affairs. Allows review boards to review the performance of such employees at any time during the two-year probationary period following their appointment and to recommend appropriate personnel actions to the Chief Medical Director. Permits the Director to accept, reject, or modify such recommendations. Requires the Director to justify any action taken which was not so recommended.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the authority of the Chief Medical Director or designee regarding review of the performance of probationary title 38 health care employees.
